Class TurtleDecorator

java.lang.Object
  TurtleDecorator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Turtle
public abstract class TurtleDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Turtle

A utility class to help write decorator subtypes of Turtle. Implements the logic of underlying turtle and redirects all method calls to that. Subclasses of TurtleDecorator should override the appropriate methods to perform whatever additional computations to do, and call the superclass version of that method.

Author:
Ilkka Kokkarinen

setPen

public void setPen(boolean up)
Set the state of the pen. When the pen is down, the turtle leaves some kind of drawing behind its movement, and when the pen is up, the turtle moves without drawing anything.

Specified by:
setPen in interface Turtle
Parameters:
down - Whether the pen is currently down.

setTurtle

public void setTurtle(Turtle turtle)
Slightly against the spirit of decorators, we allow the underlying turtle to be changed later.

Parameters:
turtle - The new underlying turtle that is being decorated.

turn

public void turn(double turnAngle)
Turn the underlying turtle in place the given angle, measured in degrees. Positive angle turns the turtle left, while a negative angle turns it right.

Specified by:
turn in interface Turtle
Parameters:
turnAngle - The angle to turn.
